intro: Brisegnoa chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean brisegnoa, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Brisegnoa chilensis is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal dunes and cliffs.
